subject: Education
title: Attention and Distraction in the Smartphone Era
description: A 60-second lesson on Attention and Distraction in the Smartphone Era.

hook.text: Students check their phones 11 times per hour during lectures. Each glance costs 25 minutes of focus.

buildup.text: Smartphones create a constant pull of notifications, social media, and entertainment.

discovery.text: Even a visible phone on the deskâ€”turned offâ€”reduces cognitive capacity by 10%.

twist.text: Phone bans improve test scores, but students report feeling anxious without their devices.

climax.text: The solution isn't banning technology but teaching self-regulation and designing phone-free focus times.

punchline.text: The barrier to learning isn't lack of information. It's distraction.

quiz.question: What does research show about a visible phone on the desk during a task?
options: Even turned off, it reduces cognitive capacity by approximately 10%
